newsitem.title: ITALY: Israel sends food to show solidarity with Albania.
newsitem.headline: Israel sends food to show solidarity with Albania.

text.p: The Israeli embassy in Rome said on Thursday it had donated 30 tonnes of wheat flour to Albania to help feed hundreds of people in the impoverished Balkan state.
"This humanitarian aid is an act of solidarity with the Albanian people, and confirms the close relations that exist between the two peoples," it said in a statement.
"(This relationship) showed itself during World War Two when the Albanians saved all the Jews in Albania from Nazi persecution."
The embassy said it handed over the flour, intended to help cover food needs for three months, on Thursday to the U.N.'s food aid agency, the Rome-based World Food Programme (WFP).
Albania slid into chaos earlier this year after the collapse of dubious investment schemes that wiped out the life savings of thousands and sparked armed unrest in the south of the country.
Italy is leading a multinational security force to oversee aid distribution in Albania.
